snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes Google making it easier to sign up for its fast broadband as a deadline approaches, the art of copying Apple and...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes Google making it easier to sign up for its fast broadband as a deadline approaches, the art of copying Apple and a man who has remade his home office in the Apple image.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Valuing Online Restaurant Reviews, and Imperfect Copying

snippet: The success of the Windows 8 operating platform will largely determine the fate of Microsoft's struggling cellphone partner, Nokia, which has bet its survival on the software.

abstract: Some major tech companies are running elaborate product announcements, hoping to grab the news media’s undivided attention before Apple announces its new iPhone on September 12; fall product introductions are important to companies seeking to generate excitement ahead of the holiday shopping season.

snippet: A company that built its brand by deftly copying and expanding on products developed by rivals, Samsung’s recent legal loss to Apple could serve as a bellwether for South Korea’s economy.
abstract: Samsung’s loss in Apple's patent violation lawsuit not only highlights the strengths and weaknesses of the company, but could serve as a bellwether for South Korea’s economy; company built its brand by deftly copying and expanding on electronics products developed by rivals.

headline.main: After Verdict, Assessing the Samsung Strategy in South Korea
headline.print_headline: After Verdict, Assessing the Samsung Strategy in South Korea

snippet: As marketers debate the efficacy of online display advertising and users ignore the standard blocks of ads found on many Web sites, many advertisers are turning to videos that blur the line between content and marketing.   On Monday, OMD, the medi...
abstract: Media Decoder blog; Omnicom's OMD will announce partnership with video platform Showyou that will allow advertisers to show users video ads alongside other video content. (M)

snippet: This month, the British newspaper The Guardian ran an interactive map of American drone strikes, pinpointing the locations in Pakistan where missiles from the unmanned aerial vehicles struck suspected terrorists. The map, which was based on data f...
abstract: Bits blog; Apple blocks from its App Store an iPhone app by graduate student Josh Begley pinpointing American drone strikes; The Guardian app, which contains a map of drone strikes in addition to other newspaper articles, was not rejected. Photos (M)g

headline.main: Apple Deems Drone Strike App Inappropriate
